arm_group.description: Use of Identification badge during scenarios (roles and places)

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate if the use of identification badge (role and place)
      during high-fidelity simulation as an impact on situation awareness.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Identification Badge on Situation Awareness During High Fidelity Simulation

detailed_description.textblock:
High-fidelity simulation is well recognized as an educational tool. Mr. Issenberg completed
      a review(2005) that determined features of high-fidelity simulation training that lead to
      effective learning. It this review, it is mentioned that the validity of the simulator
      (realism) is essential to help learners to increase their skills and sharpen their
      responses. It is essential to get and maintain engagement during high-fidelity simulation
      and it pass by an increase in realism and situation awareness. The purpose of this study is
      to evaluate if the use of identification badge (physical and conceptual realism) during
      high-fidelity simulation as an impact on situation awareness and engagement.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  anesthesiology residents (university of montreal) who participate to simulation
             course on crisis resources management

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  none

intervention.intervention_name: Use of identification badge during scenarios

clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Identification Badge on Situation Awareness During High Fidelity Simulation

primary_outcome.description:
Subjects answer a 4 questions survey on situation awareness with 7 answers choices (1-strongly disagree... 7-strongly agree)
I know where I was in the beginning of the scenario
I know where I was during the scenario
I know the role of each participant in the beginning of the scenario
I Know the role of each participant during the scenario

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description:
Subject answer a 2 questions survey on engagement with a 7 answers choices (1- strongly disagree...7-strongly agree)
I felt emotionally concerned during the scenario
The scenario was enough realistic to get engaged in the clinical situation

collaborator.agency: Centre d'apprentissage des attitudes et des habiletés cliniques (CAAHC)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Outcomes Assessor)
